author: Staff Reporter
text:
Officials taking possession of the land situated at Vellakoil in Tirupur district, which was donated to Avinashilingeswarar temple at Avinashi.

Officials of Avinashilingeswarar temple at Avinashi took the possession of 5,124 sq ft (around 11 cents) of land situated at Vellakoil, which was donated to the temple six years ago, and started the process of erecting fence along its perimeter on Sunday.

“We took the possession of the land, which is valued around Rs. 50 lakh, after a favourable order came from the Dharapuram sub-court. The space got into a legal entangle after one petitioner named Kandasamy claimed the title deed for the property immediately after the land was donated to the temple by D. Uma, a devotee from Coimbatore in 2010,” said P. Alagesan, Avinashi temple executive officer.

The land is situated close to Vellakoil municipal office.

“Two boards stating the ownership of the land has been put up now at the spot and fencing works will be completed soon,” said T. Sathyamoorthy, a lawyer-activist who has been crusading for the past few years to get back all the properties belonging to Avinashi temple lying scattered in many places.
title: Temple land retrieved
